source_sentence: 佛說救面然餓鬼陀羅尼神呪經
translation: Foshuo rescue faceless but hungry ghost dhāraṇī shenzhou jing

source_sentence: 一卷
translation: one volume

source_sentence: 唐于闐三藏實叉難陀譯
translation: Translated by the Tang translation of the Tripiṭaka of Yutan, translated by Shikṣananda

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊在迦毘羅城尼俱律那僧伽藍所，與諸比丘，并諸菩薩、無數眾生周匝圍繞，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was staying at the monastery of Nikula Monastery in the city of Kapilavastu, surrounded by monks, bodhisattvas, and countless living beings.

source_sentence: 而為說法。
translation: He teaches the Dharma for them.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難獨居淨處，一心計念。
translation: At the time, Ānanda was living alone in a pure place, singlemindedly imagining his thoughts.

source_sentence: 即於其夜三更之後，見一餓鬼，名曰「面然」，住阿難前，白阿難言：「却後三日，
translation: At three o’clock that night, he saw a hungry ghost named Maskari standing before Ānanda. He said to Ānanda:

source_sentence: 汝命將盡，即便生此餓鬼之中。」
translation: Your life will soon end, and you'll be born among these hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 是時，阿難聞此語已，心生惶怖，問餓鬼言：「我此災禍，作何方計，
translation: Having heard these words, Ānanda became frightened and asked the hungry ghosts, “Where will this calamity of mine be calculated?

source_sentence: 得免斯苦？」
translation: Will you be able to escape this suffering?

source_sentence: 爾時，餓鬼報阿難言：「汝於晨朝，若能布施百千那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，
translation: It was then that the hungry ghost reported to Ānanda, saying, In the morning, if you can give alms to hundreds of thousands of hungry ghosts as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River

source_sentence: 并百千婆羅門及仙人等，以摩伽陀國斗，各施一斗飲食，并及為我供養三寶，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of brahmans and holy men offered food and drink equal to the ounces of the kingdom’s coin, along with offerings of the Three Jewels.

source_sentence: 汝得增壽，令我離於餓鬼之苦、得生天上。」
translation: You'll increase your life span, free me from the suffering of hungry ghosts and be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 阿難見此面然餓鬼，身形羸瘦、枯燋極醜、面上火然、其咽如針、頭髮蓬亂、毛爪長利，
translation: Ānanda saw this face of a hungry ghost. His body was emaciated, extremely ugly, his hair stood on end, his throat was like a needle, his hair and nails long and slender,

source_sentence: 身如負重，又聞如是不順之語，甚大驚怖，身毛皆竪。
translation: His body was as heavy as a burden, and when he heard such uncomfortable words, he was terrified and his hair stood on end.

source_sentence: 即從座起，疾至佛所，五體投地，頂禮佛足，身心戰慄，而白佛言：「救我！
translation: He rose from his seat, rushed to the Buddha, prostrated himself on the ground with five bodies, bowed his head at his feet, trembled in body and mind, and said to him, Save me!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 救我！
translation: Please save me!

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Well done, Sugata!

source_sentence: 過此三日，命將終盡。
translation: Three days after this, his life was about to end.

source_sentence: 昨夜見一面然餓鬼，而語我言：『汝於三日，必當命盡，生餓鬼中。』
translation: Yesterday night, I saw a hungry ghost at one side and said to me, 'For three days, you will surely die and be born among hungry ghosts.'

source_sentence: 我即問言：『以何方計，得免斯苦？』
translation: I then asked, 'Where will I be able to escape this kind of suffering?'

source_sentence: 餓鬼答言：『汝若施於百千那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，及百千婆羅門并諸仙等飲食，
translation: The hungry ghosts replied, 'If you give food and drink to hundreds of thousands of hungry ghosts as numerous as the grains of sand in a hundred thousand nayutas of Ganges Rivers, and hundreds of thousands of Brāhmaṇas and other sages,

source_sentence: 汝得增壽。』
translation: You'll attain increased longevity.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今云何得免此苦？」
translation: How will I now be able to escape this suffering?

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告阿難言：「汝今勿怖！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, saying, Don't be afraid now!

source_sentence: 有異方便，令汝得施如是餓鬼、諸婆羅門及仙等食，勿生憂惱。」
translation: There's a different method that causes you to give food like this to hungry ghosts, priests, and sages so that you won't become sad and distressed.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「有陀羅尼，名曰『一切德光無量威力』。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, There's a dhāraṇī named 'The power of the light of all virtues with immeasurable authority.'

source_sentence: 若有誦此陀羅尼者，即成已施俱胝那由他百千恒河沙數餓鬼，及六十八俱胝那由他百千婆羅門并諸仙等前，
translation: If someone recites this dhāraṇī, they'll give it to as many hungry ghosts as there are grains of sand in a hundred thousand Ganges Rivers and sixty-eight koṭis of one hundred thousand Brāhmaṇas and other sages who have accomplished it.

source_sentence: 各有摩伽陀斗四斛九斗飲食。」
translation: Each has a four-thousand-pound and nine-thousand-dollar food and drink of Magadha.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「我於前世曾為婆羅門時，於觀世音菩薩及世間自在德力如來所，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: In a previous life, when I was a brāhmaṇa, I worshiped the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara Bodhisattva and the Tathāgata Sovereign World-Honored One.

source_sentence: 受此陀羅尼。
translation: Accept this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 我當以此陀羅尼力，便得具足施於無量無數餓鬼及婆羅門并仙等食，以我施諸餓鬼食故，
translation: Through the power of this dhāraṇī, I'll be able to give food to measureless and countless hungry ghosts, brāhmaṇas, and sages.

source_sentence: 捨離此身，得生天上。
translation: If they abandon this body, they'll be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝今受持此陀羅尼，當自護身。」
translation: Now, you must accept and uphold this dhāraṇī to protect yourself.

source_sentence: 即說呪曰：「那麼　薩縛(無可反，下同)　怛他揭多(去聲呼之)　縛路枳帝(一)　三(上聲，
translation: He then spoke the mantra, saying, Tathāgata (without opposing it, with the same sound as below) 他揭多(去聲呼之) 縛路帝(一) 三(上聲,

source_sentence: 下同)跋(鞞楬反，下同)囉　三跋囉(二)　虎吽(二合)(三)」佛言：「阿難！
translation: (下同)跋(反,下同)囉三跋囉(二) 虎(二合)(三」佛言:「阿難!

source_sentence: 若欲作此施食法者，先取飲食，安置淨盤器中，誦此陀羅尼呪，呪食七遍，
translation: If someone wants to perform this ritual of giving food, they first take food and drink, place it in a clean dish, recite this dhāraṇī spell seven times for seven times.

source_sentence: 於門內立，展臂戶外，置槃淨地，彈指七下。
translation: He stood inside the door, extended his arm to the outside, placed his bowl on the clean ground, and snapped his fingers seven times.

source_sentence: 作此施已，於其四方，有百千俱胝那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，於一一餓鬼前，
translation: After he had made this offering, there were hundreds of thousands of koṭis of hungry ghosts in the four directions, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River in each direction.

source_sentence: 各有摩伽陀斗四斛九斗飲食。
translation: Each has a four-thousand-pound and nine-thousand-pound food and drink of Magadha.

source_sentence: 如是鬼等，遍皆飽滿。
translation: Such ghosts and so forth are all filled with it.

source_sentence: 是諸餓鬼，喫此食已，悉捨虛身，盡得生天。」
translation: After eating this food, these hungry ghosts abandoned their empty bodies and were all born in heaven.

source_sentence: 復言：「阿難！
translation: Again, he said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若能常誦此陀羅尼并奉飲食，即為具足無量功德，
translation: If monks, nuns, laymen, and laymen can always recite this dhāraṇī and offer food and drink, that is to say, they will be endowed with immeasurable merit.

source_sentence: 命得延長；
translation: Their life spans will be extended.

source_sentence: 即成供養百千俱胝如來功德，顏色鮮潔、威德強記；
translation: They then made offerings of one hundred thousand koṭis of buddha-figures to the virtues of the enlightened ones. Their appearance was pure and beautiful, and their mighty virtue had a strong memory.

source_sentence: 一切非人、步多鬼等，夜叉、羅剎，并諸餓鬼，皆畏是人，心不忍見。
translation: All the non-humans,步多鬼等,夜叉、羅剎,并諸餓鬼,皆畏是人,心不忍見。

source_sentence: 是人即為成就具足大力勤進。」
translation: That person then accomplishes it with great vigor and diligence.

source_sentence: 復言：「阿難！
translation: Again, he said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若欲施婆羅門及仙食者，當取飲食，滿置鉢中，誦此陀羅尼呪，呪食七遍，
translation: If you want to give food to the brāhmaṇas and holy ones, you should take food and drink, place it in your almsbowl, recite this dhāraṇī spell seven times.

source_sentence: 瀉流水中。
translation: He pours it into the flowing water.

source_sentence: 具足奉獻無量俱胝百千恒河沙數婆羅門及諸仙等，如天飲食。
translation: They were fully consecrated to hundreds of thousands of koṭis of Brahmās and other sages, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 其婆羅門并仙人等，喫此食已，諸根具足、圓滿吉祥，各發其願，讚歎施人：『其施食人，
translation: Having eaten this food, the brāhmaṇas and other holy beings, each endowed with all their faculties and perfectly auspicious, each made a vow to praise the donor:

source_sentence: 心得清淨，而便疾證梵天威德，常修淨行，具足成就供養百千俱胝恒河沙數如來功德，
translation: Having attained purity of mind, they quickly realize the majestic virtues of the Brahma gods and always practice pure deeds. They are fully endowed with the merit of honoring buddhas as numerous as the number of grains of sand in a hundred thousand Ganges Rivers.

source_sentence: 於諸怨敵而常得勝。』
translation: They'll always be victorious over enemies.'

source_sentence: 「若比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若欲供養一切三寶，應當具辦香、華、飲食，
translation: “If monks, nuns, laymen, and laymen want to make offerings to all the Three Treasures, they should prepare incense, flowers, food, and drink.

source_sentence: 誦此陀羅尼呪，呪所施食及香、華等二十一遍，供養三寶。
translation: Recite this dhāraṇī of the dhāraṇī twenty-one times to offer food, incense, flowers, and other things that are given by the dhāraṇī as offerings to the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 此善男子、善女人等，具足成就諸天妙供及無上供，尊重、讚歎一切如來剎土三寶，
translation: “These sons and daughters of a virtuous family have perfected the offerings of heavenly gods and the supreme offerings, honoring and praising all the buddha-lands of the enlightened.

source_sentence: 諸佛憶念、稱揚讚歎，諸天擁護。」
translation: The buddhas remember it, praise it, and praise it, and the gods protect it.

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝去，阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, Go away, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當自護身。
translation: You must protect yourself.

source_sentence: 并及廣為諸眾生說，令諸眾生成就具足無量功德，所生之世常值百千俱胝諸佛。」
translation: It's also explained in detail for sentient beings so that they will achieve measureless merit and always meet hundreds of thousands of koṭis of buddhas in the world where they're born.

source_sentence: 佛說救面然餓鬼陀羅尼神呪經
translation: Foshuo rescue faceless but hungry ghost dhāraṇī shenzhou jing
